# R Packages

## Tidyverse


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("tidyverse")
```
:::


## Plotly


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("plotly")
```
:::


## ggthemes


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("ggthemes")
```
:::


## Esquisse


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
install.packages("esquisse")
```
:::


## Load Packages


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(ggthemes)
library(esquisse)
```
:::


# R Projects

## R Projects

R Projects are designed to contain all your data, scripts, and output in one location. This ensures that things are compatible on other computers.

## Directories (Folders)

-   data

-   output

-   scripts

# RStudio Layout

## RStudio Layout

-   Scripts

-   Console

-   Environment

-   Files

-   Everything else

# Scripts

## Adding Script

-   Use the top right corner

# Loading Data

## Downloading Data Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
u <- "https://www.inqs.info/p/plotathon/owenWilsonWows.csv"
basename(u)
download.file(u,
              file.path(getwd(), "data", basename(u)))
```
:::


## Loading Data


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds <- read_csv("data/owenWilsonWows.csv")
```
:::


# Plotting

## Base Plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) 
```
:::


## Histogram


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_histogram()
```
:::


## Box Plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_boxplot()
```
:::


## Density Plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_density()
```
:::


## Box Plot By Category


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie, y = era)) +
  geom_boxplot()
```
:::


## Density Plot By Category


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie, color = era)) +
  geom_density()
```
:::


## Scatter Plot


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point()
```
:::


## Scatter Plot by Group


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie, color = era)) +
  geom_point()
```
:::


## Add Regression Line


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = F)
```
:::


## Smooth Line


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(se = F)
```
:::


## Regression Lines by Group


::: {.cell}

```{.r .cell-code}
mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie,
                  color = era)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = F)
```
:::

<script>
  // htmlwidgets need to know to resize themselves when slides are shown/hidden.
  // Fire the "slideenter" event (handled by htmlwidgets.js) when the current
  // slide changes (different for each slide format).
  (function () {
    // dispatch for htmlwidgets
    function fireSlideEnter() {
      const event = window.document.createEvent("Event");
      event.initEvent("slideenter", true, true);
      window.document.dispatchEvent(event);
    }

    function fireSlideChanged(previousSlide, currentSlide) {
      fireSlideEnter();

      // dispatch for shiny
      if (window.jQuery) {
        if (previousSlide) {
          window.jQuery(previousSlide).trigger("hidden");
        }
        if (currentSlide) {
          window.jQuery(currentSlide).trigger("shown");
        }
      }
    }

    // hookup for slidy
    if (window.w3c_slidy) {
      window.w3c_slidy.add_observer(function (slide_num) {
        // slide_num starts at position 1
        fireSlideChanged(null, w3c_slidy.slides[slide_num - 1]);
      });
    }

  })();
</script>
